intro: Phlegmariurus tenuis, commonly known as the slender thyrone, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a mat-forming plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. The plant has a distinctive structure with a prostrate stem and leafy shoots that are often arranged in a spiral pattern. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, develop from the leafy shoots and produce spores for propagation. This liverwort plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
